prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The prism is centered on a vertical axis. Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5714, 0.0] Sketch Create a sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of several faces, loops, and curves. Face 1 Face 1 is a circle with a center at [0.0893, 0.4107] and a radius of 0.0893. Face 2 Face 2 is a more complex loop with several curves: * Line from [0.0004, 0.4018] to [0.036, 0.0482] * Arc from [0.036, 0.0482] to [0.0893, 0.0] with midpoint at [0.1252, 0.0933] * Line from [0.0893, 0.0] to [0.3393, 0.0] * Arc from [0.3393, 0.0] to [0.3393, 0.0893] with midpoint at [0.2946, 0.0446] * Line from [0.3393, 0.0893] to [0.1538, 0.0893] * Line from [0.1538, 0.0893] to [0.1783, 0.4038] * Arc from [0.1783, 0.4038] to [0.0004, 0.4018] with midpoint at [0.0903, 0.3214] Face 3 Face 3 is another complex loop with several curves: * Arc from [0.0007, 0.4219] to [0.1779, 0.4219] with midpoint at [0.0893, 0.5] * Line from [0.1779, 0.4219] to [0.1424, 0.7031] * Arc from [0.1424, 0.7031] to [0.0361, 0.7031] with midpoint at [0.0893, 0.6429] * Line from [0.0361, 0.7031] to [0.0007, 0.4219] Face 4 and Face 5 Face 4 and Face 5 are circles with centers at [0.0893, 0.0536] and [0.0893, 0.6964], respectively, and with radii of 0.0536 and 0.0179. Face 6 Face 6 is a circle with a center at [0.3393, 0.0446] and a radius of 0.0446. The sketch is complete after creating all the faces, loops, and curves. Extrusion Extrude the sketch in the direction of the normal by 0.5714 units and in the opposite direction by 0 units. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 before extruding. The operation is a "New Body Feature Operation". The final dimensions of the part are: * Length: 0.75 m (the sketch scale factor is applied here) * Width: 0.5714 m * Height: 0.75 m (the extrusion depth)</description>

<description>**CAD Model Instructions** **Part 1** Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0.25) with no rotation. *Sketch Face 1*: Create a new sketch on the XY plane. *Loop 1*: Draw a circle centered at (0.1818, 0.1818) with a radius of 0.1818. *Loop 2*: Draw a circle centered at (0.1818, 0.1818) with a radius of 0.1681. *Extrusion*: Extrude the sketch by 0.5 towards the positive Z direction and by 0.0 in the opposite direction. Scale the sketch by 0.3636. **Part 2** Construct a cylindrical object with a central hole, resembling a washer or a ring. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.0137, 0.1293, 0.25) with no rotation. *Sketch Face 1*: Create a new sketch on the XY plane. *Loop 1*: Draw an arc from (0.3278, 0.0) to (0.3278, 0.1049) with a midpoint at (0.3361, 0.0525). Draw another arc from (0.3278, 0.1049) to (0.3278, 0.0) with a midpoint at (0.0, 0.0525). *Loop 2*: Draw a circle centered at (0.1675, 0.0525) with a radius of 0.0452. *Extrusion*: Extrude the sketch by 0.025 towards the positive Z direction and by 0.0 in the opposite direction. Scale the sketch by 0.3361. **Part 3** Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.1351, 0.1363, 0.25) with no rotation. *Sketch Face 1*: Create a new sketch on the XY plane. *Loop 1*: Draw a circle centered at (0.0461, 0.0461) with a radius of 0.0461. *Loop 2*: Draw a circle centered at (0.0461, 0.0461) with a radius of 0.0409. *Extrusion*: Extrude the sketch by 0.0 towards the positive Z direction and by 0.25 in the opposite direction. Scale the sketch by 0.0922. The final CAD model will be a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, connected to a cylindrical base by a cylindrical shaft. The top and bottom cylindrical parts will have a slightly tapered shape, while the central shaft will have a uniform cross-section. The top and bottom cylindrical parts will have a height of 0.3636, width of 0.3636, and length of 0.5. The central shaft will have a height of 0.25, width of 0.0922, and length of 0.0922.</description>
